intro: Hulsea, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It consists of about 20 species, predominantly found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and small, umbellate inflorescences. Hulsea species typically have smooth, often hairy leaves and produce white or greenish flowers. They are generally herbaceous perennials that thrive in moist, shaded environments.
